1: Then Yahweh called to Job out of a fierce storm and said,\q
2:
"Who is this who brings darkness to plans\q by means of words without knowledge?
\q
3:
Now gird up your loins like a man\q for I will ask you questions, and you must answer me.


\q
4:
Where were you when I laid the earth's foundations?\q Tell me, if you have so much understanding.
\q
5:
Who determined its dimensions? Tell me, if you know.\q Who stretched the measuring line over it?


\q
6:
On what were its foundations laid?\q Who laid its cornerstone
\q
7:
when the morning stars sang together\q and all the sons of God shouted for joy?


\q
8:
Who shut up the sea with doors\q when it burst out, as if it had come out of the womb—
\q
9:
when I made clouds its clothing,\q and thick darkness its swaddling bands?


\q
10:
That was when I marked out for the sea my boundary,\q and when I placed its bars and doors,
\q
11:
and when I said to it, 'You may come this far, but no farther;\q here is where I will put a boundary to the pride of your waves.'


\q
12:
Have you given orders to the morning,\q or caused the dawn to know its place,
\q
13:
so that it might take hold of the edges of the earth\q and shake the wicked out of it?


\q
14:
The earth is changed in appearance like clay changes under a seal;\q all things on it stand out clearly like the folds of a piece of clothing.
\q
15:
From wicked people their 'light' is taken away;\q their uplifted arm is broken.


\q
16:
Have you gone to the sources of the waters of the sea?\q Have you walked in the lowest parts of the deep?
\q
17:
Have the gates of death been revealed to you?\q Have you seen the gates of the shadow of death?
\q
18:
Have you understood the earth in its expanse?\q Tell me, if you know it all.


\q
19:
Where is the way to the resting place of light—\q as for darkness, where is its place?
\q
20:
Can you lead light and darkness to their places of work?\q Can you find the way back to their houses for them?
\q
21:
Undoubtedly you know, for you were born then;\q the number of your days is so large!


\q
22:
Have you entered the storehouses for the snow,\q or have you seen the storehouses for the hail,
\q
23:
these things that I have kept for times of trouble,\q for days of battle and war?
\q
24:
What is the path to where the lightning bolts are distributed\q or to where the winds are scattered from the east over the earth?


\q
25:
Who has created the channels for the floods of rain,\q or who has made a path for the thunder,
\q
26:
to cause it to rain on lands where no person exists,\q and on the wilderness, in which there is no one,
\q
27:
to satisfy the devastated and desolate places,\q and to make the ground sprout with grass?


\q
28:
Does the rain have a father,\q or, who fathers the drops of dew?
\q
29:
Out of whose womb did the ice come?\q Who bore the white frost out of the sky?
\q
30:
The waters hide themselves and become like stone;\q the surface of the deep becomes frozen.


\q
31:
Can you fasten chains on the Pleiades,\q or undo the cords of Orion?
\q
32:
Can you lead the constellations to appear at their proper times?\q Can you guide the Bear with its children?
\q
33:
Do you know the regulations of the sky?\q Could you set in place the sky's rule over the earth?


\q
34:
Can you raise your voice up to the clouds,\q so that an abundance of rainwater may cover you?
\q
35:
Can you send out bolts of lightning that they may go out,\q that they say to you, 'Here we are'?


\q
36:
Who has put wisdom in the clouds\q or has given understanding to the mists?
\q
37:
Who can number the clouds by his skill?\q Who can pour out the water skins of the sky
\q
38:
when the dust runs into a hard mass\q and the clods of earth clump tightly together?


\q
39:
Can you hunt down a victim for a lioness\q or satisfy the appetite of her young lion cubs
\q
40:
when they are crouching in their dens\q and sheltering in hiding to lie in wait?


\q
41:
Who provides victims for the ravens\q when their young ones cry out to God
\q and stagger about for lack of food?
